review_text: Perfect! One of my favorite stays and experiences with a host. Chad immediately confirmed my reservation. Permitted me to enter when I arrived a tad before check-in. The house was spotless, tastefully decorated pulling from the Mayberry theme, and the southern charm of the local town into the interior design. It's spacious, open, and has everything, e.g. an awesome floor fan. It was wonderfully cool when I arrived. No house is directly across the street, easy Door Dash, strong Wi-fi, large TV. Well-groomed, large backyard for dog, kids, games. Breakfast nook is inviting. Deck is high from ground, but a gate at top allowed the dog lay in the sun, securely. There's 10 steps on deck. I would've loved to spend more time in this charming space and town. A rooster nearby crows, but didn't bother me. Chad was polite, responsive, concise, and available, but did not over-text with check-ins/rules. He communicated necessities, then left me to enjoy his space and contact him if needed.⭐️

review_text:
Charming Home with Local Flair
We had a wonderful stay at this charming Airbnb! The host was incredibly friendly and made sure we had everything we needed throughout our visit. The house was spotlessly clean, and we appreciated the lovely local decorations that added character to the space.
Our kids absolutely adored the cozy kitchen nook, and spotting a groundhog in the backyard and the neighbor's chickens was a memorable part of their trip.
However, the only downside was that the bed was not as comfortable as we had hoped. We're accustomed to sleeping on a Tempur-pedic mattress, so the spring mattress provided was a bit of an adjustment for us. Despite this minor inconvenience, we thoroughly enjoyed our time here and would definitely consider staying again in the future. Highly recommend for a cozy and authentic local experience!

The house itself, though definitely older and seemingly appointed specifically for Air BnB use, was clean, spacious, and peaceful.
The hosts were thorough, friendly, and informative. We appreciated all the ideas on what to do and where to eat. The art walk was my favorite :) As other reviewers have mentioned, there’s updating happening on the street - the house next door had a broken out window so was a little wary to pull up next to at night but we noticed construction workers there the next day and all was well during our 4 night stay. We would probably stay again!

We really enjoyed our stay here. It's away from it all and yet only 15 - 20 minutes from Mount Airy and so many other locations. Thanks so much!

review_text: If you are looking for a peaceful getaway in an idyllic setting then this is the place for you. Suzanne and Phil are the most friendly and gracious of hosts. We sampled some delicious fresh eggs and took advantage of our run of the property. There are well manicured mown trails to reach all 80 acres with a beautiful pond that has a bench and a picnic table for some quiet reflection or a peaceful lunch. Make sure to say hi to Fluffy by the cow shed. He looks like a great mouser and is an exceedingly friendly cat. The gazebo near the house looks like a wonderful spot for a small wedding reception or a nice fire on a cool fall evening. And those views. Wow! The sunrises are spectacular and the cabin is well positioned to take advantage of them. I would highly recommend and definitely plan to return. 5*+.

We enjoyed sitting out on the front porch, drinking our coffee & watching our fur baby Snoopy enjoy strolling around the fenced in front yard. The kitchen was awesome! The living room, bedrooms & bathrooms were cozy & very clean. Tonya left us maps & brochures to explore Mt. Airy/Mayberry & we used them too! So great taking an Andy Griffith tour around 'Mayberry'! There are many wonderful nature things to see, plus vineyards! We enjoyed dinner at The Loaded Goat, Tonya has recommendations of places to eat & we followed her advice! We HIGHLY recommend visiting Mt. Airy & staying with Tonya, she is a wonderful host!
P.S. Snoopy LOVED Red Brush Charmer, didn't want to leave! If your fur baby or child feel comfortable, that says a LOT about a place! :D Thank you Tonya!

review_text: What a lovely, cozy, charming home! I went for a few days of rest and refilling and to plan our next homeschool term. I LOVED sitting on the front porch with books in my lap and coffee on the table and being able to look across the nearby fields and see clouds scudding across the sky; also loved hearing and watching the cows. In the mornings there was a very enthusiastic rooster who greeted the day with such joy - and who was just far enough away to be charming. :) My bed was soft, comfy and clean. The kitchen was lovely, clean and bright. It was close enough to Mt. Airy that I could visit a bagel shop that our daughter had recommended - yum! - but far enough out that it felt private and quiet. The road in front of the house is sometimes loud and busy, but the action seems to be concentrated at only certain times of the day. Lovely home, decorated with care; loved the wall art and cute signs - some of which I have in my own home. Hope to be back.

Consider Tonya’s home away from home.

Suggest staying two+ nights to cross all the fun sights of Mayberry USA off your bucket list.

Highly recommend Tonya’s Airbnb.

review_text: I usually stay at hotels for business travel, but when I saw the price of the one I'd usually stay at in the area (a national chain), I balked, and since I use Airbnb several times a year, checked out listings for Mount Airy. I was amazed to see such a reasonable price for Brandon and Taylor's "loft," which, in fact, I would characterize more as an apartment. The space was several times larger than a room at a hotel, not to mention it had a separate kitchen, dining nook, living room, and nice bedroom with a nice-sized bathroom. Everything was clean, it was well stocked (as I typically iron pants, etc., I was glad to see it had an iron and ironing board), and with a TV in the living room and a TV in the bedroom, I had everything I needed. At the end of the business day, it was great to relax on the big couch in the living room with tall ceilings and its wood walls that made the place feel warm. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat if in the area on business!

review_text:
We chose to stay at Catherine's as a stop along I-77. The price was reasonable and the experience was unique.
Catherine's place was magical! We settled into the older farm cottage and headed over to the suggested property to get a glimpse of bison. The kids enjoyed seeing them up close from inside the car. Then, we went back to the cottage to play in the stream. (Recommend bringing water shoes for the kids, as we spotted two pieces of glass). Later in the evening, the bison came running down the hill and grazed for the rest of the night in our yard. They even came pretty close to the front porch!
Inside the house, the kitchen was well-equipped and comfortable. We all found the beds to be great and provided a wonderful night's sleep before continuing on I-77. The children's bedrooms are very close to the bathroom and kitchen. I'd recommend a sound machine to drown out some of the noise.
Overall, we loved our stay and would do it again in a heartbeat.

For persons with physical disabilities (note: host informed me before booking): 1) large step into the house from back door, very very steep for lifting wheelchair 2) no grab bars anywhere. There is enough room inside to move about comfortably in a chair.

5 Stars * * * * * We loved this place.

Catherine was easy to communicate with and responded quickly. Her cottage is very well stocked with anything you could possibly need for a fun family vacay, including children's toys, scooters, books, board games, cornhole, etc.
We really enjoyed seeing the Bison coming into the pasture out front in the mornings and evenings, with a few coming by the cottage munching away on the grass off the porch nearby. The fresh eggs she provided were so delicious!
Mt. Airy downtown is only 20 min. away and her online guest book is spot on with lots of fun things to see and do, plus great places to dine. We especially enjoyed hiking Pilot and Stone Mts., The Thursday Night Wine Club tasting with horderves @ the Old North State Winery downtown, and dining @ 13 Bones.

We had many great experiences and plan to return!
Thanks, Catherine :-)
